fields.Title of Presentation: Converging the Basic Course: Utilizing Interdisciplinary Connections to Create an Applied and Professional Oral Communication
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Central States Communication Association Annual Conference
fields.Description/Abstract:
Chair: Amanda Brown, University of Wisconsin, Stout
Presenters: 
MaryFrances Casper, Boise State University
Laura C. Farrell, Longwood University
Derek Jorgenson, Pennsylvania State University
Basic course instructors may not be well-versed in their students’ majors, making it difficult to
help students adapt presentations to their chosen field. This discussion panel explores strategies
for converging the basic course with the university community and creating a more
interdisciplinary and professional basic course experience for the students and the instructors.
Specifically, we will explore the benefits of creating interdisciplinary relationships with faculty
and industry and integrating that interdisciplinarity into assignments and curriculum.
